data: Verify that an 'Admit to' Order has been entered prior to completing the powerplan (NOT required for direct admit patients)
Complete BC Children's Hospital DKA Protocol
Refer to BCCH Diabetic Ketoacidosis Nursing Protocol for DKA management guidelines
q1h, heart rate, respiratory rate, temperature
q2h, heart rate, respiratory rate, temperature
q4h, heart rate, respiratory rate, temperature
q12h, heart rate, respiratory rate, temperature
Document and check urine for ketones qvoid
Call treating provider with all STAT bloodwork results during the acute phase of DKA
If patient develops severe headache or alteration in vital signs or Glasgow Coma Scale Score,
Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Pediatric Newly Diagnosed, 3 meals and 3 snacks
Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Pediatric Newly Diagnosed, Gluten Free, 3 meals and 3 snacks
Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Pediatric Newly Diagnosed, No Pork, 3 meals and 3 snacks
Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Pediatric Newly Diagnosed, Vegetarian, 3 meals and 3 snacks
Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Standard, 3 meals and 3 snacks
Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Standard, Gluten Free, 3 meals and 3 snacks
Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Standard, No Pork, 3 meals and 3 snacks
Therapeutic Diet: Diabetes Standard, Vegetarian, 3 meals and 3 snacks
Diabetes Standard, Pureed, 3 meals and 3 snacks
Diabetes Standard, Minced, 3 meals and 3 snacks
Diabetes Standard, Cut Up, 3 meals and 3 snacks
PED Peripheral IV and IV Fluids (Module)
Use DKA Protocol to determine rates for Bag A, B and C (Sum of Bag A rate PLUS Bag B rate determined from DKA protocol, line 8 to keep glucose 8-12 mmol/L
If dextrose 12.5% NS is not available, select dextrose 10% NS
Refer to BCCH DKA Recipes for dextrose reconstitution instructions
insulin regular PED continuous infusion (0.1 unit/mL) NS standard
insulin regular PED continuous infusion (0.1 unit/mL) NS standard
insulin regular PED continuous infusion (0.1 unit/mL) NS standard
insulin regular PED continuous infusion (0.1 unit/mL) NS standard
Blood, AM Draw, Collection: T+1;0330, once
If patient on continuous IV infusions then consider daily electrolytes
Basic Metabolic Panel (Lytes, Urea, Creat, Gluc)
